                       <img alt="" class="attachment-full size-full" decoding="async" height="1709" sizes="(max-width: 2560px) 100vw, 2560px" src="https://eswochy.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/mru_2023_09_11-39-3-scaled.jpg" srcset="https://eswochy.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/mru_2023_09_11-39-3-scaled.jpg 2560w, https://eswochy.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/mru_2023_09_11-39-3-300x200.jpg 300w, https://eswochy.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/mru_2023_09_11-39-3-1024x684.jpg 1024w, https://eswochy.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/mru_2023_09_11-39-3-768x513.jpg 768w" width="2560"/>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-50 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-dfd4417" data-element_type="column" data-id="dfd4417">
                  <div class="elementor-column-wrap elementor-element-populated">
                   <div class="elementor-widget-wrap">
                    <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-363811e elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="363811e" data-widget_type="heading.default">
                     <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                      <h2 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
                       The aim of ESWOCHY is to prepare highly skilled professionals to be leaders in the field of international, intercultural and comparative social work with children and youth.
                      </h2>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-34891ba elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="34891ba" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
                     <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                      <div class="elementor-text-editor elementor-clearfix">
                       <p>
                        The students will possess an educational and experiential foundation that combines theories of social work, social sciences, humanities and indigenous knowledge, comparative international research, policy development and the newest knowledge of using ICT in social work practice with children and youth.
                       </p>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </section>
              <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-1c34abba elementor-section-content-middle elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="1c34abba" data-settings='{"background_background":"classic","shape_divider_top":"tilt","shape_divider_bottom":"tilt"}'>
               <div class="elementor-shape elementor-shape-top" data-negative="false">
                <svg preserveaspectratio="none" viewbox="0 0 1000 100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
                 <path class="elementor-shape-fill" d="M0,6V0h1000v100L0,6z">
                 </path>
                </svg>
               </div>
               <div class="elementor-shape elementor-shape-bottom" data-negative="false">
                <svg preserveaspectratio="none" viewbox="0 0 1000 100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
                 <path class="elementor-shape-fill" d="M0,6V0h1000v100L0,6z">
                 </path>
                </svg>
               </div>
               <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
                <div class="elementor-row">
                 <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-50 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-d633ebd" data-element_type="column" data-id="d633ebd">
                  <div class="elementor-column-wrap elementor-element-populated">
                   <div class="elementor-widget-wrap">
                    <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-6b616df1 elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="6b616df1" data-widget_type="heading.default">
                     <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                      <h2 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
                       The duration of ESWOCHY  is 2 years (120 ECTS).
                      </h2>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-63d965b elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="63d965b" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
                     <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                      <div class="elementor-text-editor elementor-clearfix">
                       The theoretical study block is designed to train specialists with knowledge of national and European children and youth policy trends, human rights and human diversity, able to plan, coordinate and innovate in social service, responding to the patterns of modern youth socialization, effectively organizing social work with various youth groups, career guidance and liberation of self-actualization and fulfilment. An emphasis is also on intercultural competences such as intercultural mediation that ensure dialogue between different ethnic groups, enabling the education of society, especially children and young people, about other cultures. This helps to expand students’ abilities to work with children and youth in an international, multicultural perspective. Exceptional attention is on digital social work and entrepreneurship skills of students. Internship “Scientific Research Practice” is an integral part of the study process and  aims to help students to integrate theory, research-based knowledge and practical social work strategies and skills, through different social work activities with children and youth developing cultural sensitivity and respect for diversities and enabling students to collect data for their master thesis.
                      </div>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>

                      <div class="elementor-text-editor elementor-clearfix">
                       With the support of the Erasmus+ Programme of the European Union, the Consortium of Mykolas Romeris University (Lithuania) (coordinator),  Riga Stradins University (Latvia), the Catholic University in Ruzomberok (Slovakia) and the ISCTE University Institute of Lisbon (Portugal) presents

                       <img alt="" class="attachment-full size-full" decoding="async" height="1709" sizes="(max-width: 2560px) 100vw, 2560px" src="https://eswochy.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/mru_2023_09_11-39-3-scaled.jpg" srcset="https://eswochy.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/mru_2023_09_11-39-3-scaled.jpg 2560w, https://eswochy.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/mru_2023_09_11-39-3-300x200.jpg 300w, https://eswochy.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/mru_2023_09_11-39-3-1024x684.jpg 1024w, https://eswochy.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/mru_2023_09_11-39-3-768x513.jpg 768w" width="2560"/>
                      </div>

                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-50 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-dfd4417" data-element_type="column" data-id="dfd4417">
                  <div class="elementor-column-wrap elementor-element-populated">
                   <div class="elementor-widget-wrap">
                    <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-363811e elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="363811e" data-widget_type="heading.default">
                     <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                      <h2 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
                       The aim of ESWOCHY is to prepare highly skilled professionals to be leaders in the field of international, intercultural and comparative social work with children and youth.
                      </h2>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-34891ba elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="34891ba" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
                     <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                      <div class="elementor-text-editor elementor-clearfix">
                       <p>
                        The students will possess an educational and experiential foundation that combines theories of social work, social sciences, humanities and indigenous knowledge, comparative international research, policy development and the newest knowledge of using ICT in social work practice with children and youth.
                       </p>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </section>
              <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-1c34abba elementor-section-content-middle elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="1c34abba" data-settings='{"background_background":"classic","shape_divider_top":"tilt","shape_divider_bottom":"tilt"}'>
               <div class="elementor-shape elementor-shape-top" data-negative="false">
                <svg preserveaspectratio="none" viewbox="0 0 1000 100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
                 <path class="elementor-shape-fill" d="M0,6V0h1000v100L0,6z">
                 </path>
                </svg>
               </div>
               <div class="elementor-shape elementor-shape-bottom" data-negative="false">
                <svg preserveaspectratio="none" viewbox="0 0 1000 100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
                 <path class="elementor-shape-fill" d="M0,6V0h1000v100L0,6z">
                 </path>
                </svg>
               </div>
               <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
                <div class="elementor-row">
                 <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-50 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-d633ebd" data-element_type="column" data-id="d633ebd">
                  <div class="elementor-column-wrap elementor-element-populated">
                   <div class="elementor-widget-wrap">
                    <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-6b616df1 elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="6b616df1" data-widget_type="heading.default">
                     <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                      <h2 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
                       The duration of ESWOCHY  is 2 years (120 ECTS).
                      </h2>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-63d965b elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="63d965b" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
                     <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                      <div class="elementor-text-editor elementor-clearfix">
                       The theoretical study block is designed to train specialists with knowledge of national and European children and youth policy trends, human rights and human diversity, able to plan, coordinate and innovate in social service, responding to the patterns of modern youth socialization, effectively organizing social work with various youth groups, career guidance and liberation of self-actualization and fulfilment. An emphasis is also on intercultural competences such as intercultural mediation that ensure dialogue between different ethnic groups, enabling the education of society, especially children and young people, about other cultures. This helps to expand students’ abilities to work with children and youth in an international, multicultural perspective. Exceptional attention is on digital social work and entrepreneurship skills of students. Internship “Scientific Research Practice” is an integral part of the study process and  aims to help students to integrate theory, research-based knowledge and practical social work strategies and skills, through different social work activities with children and youth developing cultural sensitivity and respect for diversities and enabling students to collect data for their master thesis.
                      </div>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>

      <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
       <div class="content-wrap">
        <article class="entry content-bg single-entry post-1005 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-1005">
         <div class="entry-content-wrap">
          <div class="entry-content single-content">
           <h1>
            About ESWOCHY
           </h1>
           <h5>
            European Joint Master in Social Work with Children and Youth
           </h5>
           <p>
            <img alt="" decoding="async" height="576" loading="lazy" sizes="auto, (max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://eswochy.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/ESWOCHY-Logo-1024x576.png" srcset="https://eswochy.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/ESWOCHY-Logo-1024x576.png 1024w, https://eswochy.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/ESWOCHY-Logo-300x169.png 300w, https://eswochy.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/ESWOCHY-Logo-768x432.png 768w, https://eswochy.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/ESWOCHY-Logo-1536x864.png 1536w, https://eswochy.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/ESWOCHY-Logo.png 1920w" width="1024"/>
           </p>
           <p>
            With the support of the Erasmus+ Programme of the European Union, the Consortium of Mykolas Romeris University (Lithuania) (coordinator), Riga Stradins University (Latvia), the Catholic University in Ruzomberok (Slovakia) and the ISCTE University Institute of Lisbon (Portugal) presents “European Joint Master in Social Work with Children and Youth”. ESWOCHY programme is based on three pillars:
            <br/>
            • humanistic perspective,
            <br/>
            • intercultural communication,
            <br/>
            • digital social work.
           </p>
           <h2>
            The duration of ESWOCHY  is 2 years (120 ECTS).
           </h2>
           <p>
            The theoretical study block is designed to train specialists with knowledge of national and European children and youth policy trends, human rights and human diversity, able to plan, coordinate and innovate in social service, responding to the patterns of modern youth socialization, effectively organizing social work with various youth groups, career guidance and liberation of self-actualization and fulfilment. An emphasis is also on intercultural competences such as intercultural mediation that ensure dialogue between different ethnic groups, enabling the education of society, especially children and young people, about other cultures. This helps to expand students’ abilities to work with children and youth in an international, multicultural perspective. Exceptional attention is on digital social work and entrepreneurship skills of students. Internship “Scientific Research Practice” is an integral part of the study process and  aims to help students to integrate theory, research-based knowledge and practical social work strategies and skills, through different social work activities with children and youth developing cultural sensitivity and respect for diversities and enabling students to collect data for their master thesis.
            <br/>
            <img alt="pexels-karolina-grabowska-4497733" decoding="async" src="https://eswochy.eu/wp-content/uploads/elementor/thumbs/pexels-karolina-grabowska-4497733-scaled-p0tv1c1fmyq6dwy3zivhjtaj7d3c7ruzjfn7xo9jfk.jpg" title="pexels-karolina-grabowska-4497733"/>
            <br/>
            <img alt="pexels-iqwan-alif-1206101" decoding="async" src="https://eswochy.eu/wp-content/uploads/elementor/thumbs/pexels-iqwan-alif-1206101-scaled-p0tuw261afi98olws8suk57f7j370wx7hbv4zs32cg.jpg" title="pexels-iqwan-alif-1206101"/>
           </p>
           <h2>
            The aim of ESWOCHY is to prepare highly skilled professionals to be leaders in the field of international, intercultural and comparative social work with children and youth.
           </h2>
           <p>
            The students will possess an educational and experiential foundation that combines theories of social work, social sciences, humanities and indigenous knowledge, comparative international research, policy development and the newest knowledge of using ICT in social work practice with children and youth.
           </p>
          </div>
          <!-- .entry-content -->
         </div>
        </article>

                      <div class="elementor-text-editor elementor-clearfix">
                       <p>
                        On the 2
                        <sup>
                         nd
                        </sup>
                        of August the Diploma Award Ceremony of Erasmus Mundus European Joint Master in Social Work with Children and Youth (ESWOCHY) was held at Iscte (Portugal).
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        We are delighted that after 2 years 14 students from 12 countries have graduated from the programme.
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        We wish them the greatest professional success!

                      <h1 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-large">
                       The Diploma Award Ceremony of ESWOCHY
                      </h1>
                     </div>

                     <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                      <div class="elementor-text-editor elementor-clearfix">
                       <p>
                        We are delighted to announce that first cohort of ESWOCHY have successfully completed their thesis defense.
                        <br/>
                        Students of the first cohort had an idea for the round table session, which involved presenting a Digest of their master theses. The Digest consisted of a collection of students master theses, focusing on specific parts such as the abstract, author details, and the impact of the study on social work with children and youth practices.
                        <br/>
                        During the round table discussion, students provided paper copies of the Digest to all participants, ensured that everyone can engage in a relaxed and insightful conversation about our theses.
                        <br/>
                        <br/>
                        <br/>
                        <br/>
                       </p>

                    <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-cb2391a elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="cb2391a" data-widget_type="heading.default">
                     <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                      <h2 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
                       Opening Ceremony of ESWOCHY Programme for the 2nd cohort
                      </h2>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-5cd6997 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="5cd6997" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
                     <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                      <div class="elementor-text-editor elementor-clearfix">
                       <p>
                        Sept. 5th, 2022, guests, partners and students from as many as 14 countries gathered to celebrate the opening of the Erasmus Mundus program “Social Work with Children and Youth – ESWOCHY”. The opening ceremony was attended by students from Azerbaijan, Cameroon, Ethiopia, Germany, Ghana, Kazakhstan, Latvia, Nepal, Nigeria, Poland, Philippines, Russia, Spain and Uganda.
                        <span style="background-color: transparent; color: var(--global-palette6); font-family: var(--global-body-font-family);">
                         The students of the second cohort were congratulated at the celebration held at MRU by the head of the program, vice dean for science of the Faculty of Human and Society Studies of MRU Dr. Raminta Bardauskienė, Anna Broha from Riga Stradini University, Marketa Rusnakova from the Catholic University of Ruzamberok and Sedar Dobur, a graduate of the Joint Social Work with Children and Youth Program.
                        </span>
                        <span style="background-color: transparent; color: var(--global-palette6); font-family: var(--global-body-font-family);">
                         The Erasmus Mundus European Joint Masters in Social Work with Children and Youth (ESWOCHY) program has been running since 2020. and this September 5th welcomed the second student show. The first student show started the third semester at the Catholic University of Ruzamberok.
                        </span>
                       </p>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </section>

                  <div class="elementor-column-wrap elementor-element-populated">
                   <div class="elementor-widget-wrap">
                    <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-287115f5 elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="287115f5" data-widget_type="heading.default">
                     <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                      <h2 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
                       ESWOCHY students meeting at Mykolas Romeris University
                      </h2>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-44738462 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="44738462" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
                     <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                      <div class="elementor-text-editor elementor-clearfix">
                       <p>
                        <span lang="lt">
                         2nd year students (2020-2021 intake) of Joint Master Programme in Social Work with Children and Youth met with 1st year (2021-2022 intake) students of European Joint Master in Social Work with Children and Youth (ESWOCHY) at Mykolas Romeris University. This was a great event for the ESWOCHY students before starting their studies on 13th of September. 2nd year students shared their experience in the programme. Inter alia students advised their colleagues to keep notes, to communicate, to be flexible, to prepare tasks on time, to make friends with  local students, to be open-minded, to keep the rules but to be themselves, to have free time, to rest; to avoid judging; be on time; to get used to native food; to travel, etc. There was a lot of laughter, questions and a good mood. This helped ESWOCHY students relax and make contact with experienced graduating students.
                        </span>
                       </p>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>

                      <h2 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
                       Great Opening Ceremony of ESWOCHY Programme
                      </h2>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-9485fa6 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="9485fa6" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
                     <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                      <div class="elementor-text-editor elementor-clearfix">
                       <p>
                        Sept. 13th, 2021, at the MRU LAB, the grand opening of the European Joint Master in Social Work with Children and Youth was held and MRU Rector Prof. Inga Žalėnienė addressed guests and students gathered for the occasion. Currently it is the first and only programme coordinated by a higher education institution in Lithuania, which is implemented with a consortium of universities including: Latvia’s Riga Stradins University, Slovakia’s Catholic University in Ružomberok, Portugal’s Lisabon University Institute and Mykolas Romeris University. Guests from Lithuania and abroad greeted students and the academic community as well as all those gathered at the event.
                       </p>

                   </div>

                 </div>

              <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-5484178 elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="5484178">

                     <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                      <div class="elementor-text-editor elementor-clearfix">
                       <h2 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default elementor-inline-editing pen" contenteditable="true" data-elementor-setting-key="title" data-pen-placeholder="Type Here...">
                        Student from Philippines combines studies @MRU with lectures to students online in Philippines
                       </h2>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-585af77 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="585af77" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
                     <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                      <div class="elementor-text-editor elementor-clearfix">
                       <p>
                        Philippine student Jeffrey Razonabe is not your typical Master‘s Degree student at MRU. He lectures online to Social Work students in the Philippines at the University of Southern Philippines Foundation. He has a license as a registered social worker in the Philippines and has plans to study in a PhD programme in Europe. For now, he is celebrating many „firsts“ in Vilnius. Jeffrey will spend his first winter in Europe – in Vilnius and can’t wait to see snow and build his first snowman. It‘s the 1st time he has ever visited Europe and he‘s getting accustomed to colder weather. “I am ignorant about winter and I want to prepare,” said the 25-year-old Master’s Degree student. But Social Work is his real passion and the reason he enrolled in the “
                        <em>
                         European Joint Master in Social Work with Children and  Youth“
                        </em>
                        programme. Read more
                        <a href="https://www.mruni.eu/en/news/student-from-philippines-not-only-a-student-but-a-lecturer-in-the-philippines-teaching-online/?fbclid=IwAR3oq3NEl7hrO0nWCQAwGrAJpMKcZDY9HRrbgGW0q5LtGjbGBd-vtuGRlyk">
                         here
                        </a>
                        .
                       </p>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </section>
              <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-292a201 elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="292a201">

                     <div class="elementor-widget-container">

                       <h2 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default elementor-inline-editing pen" contenteditable="true" data-elementor-setting-key="title" data-pen-placeholder="Type Here...">
                        Social Work Master’s Programme draws Students from all over the world
                       </h2>
                       <p>
                        The unique MRU European Joint Master in Social Work with Children and Youth (ESWOCHY) draws students from all over the world to Vilnius to study in the Master’s Degree programme. Read more
                        <a href="https://www.mruni.eu/en/news/european-joint-master-in-social-work-with-children-youth-is-life-changing/?fbclid=IwAR3HHA1LMExCCyBe62lhMXrZ2obEsSczm1QN7TSyauK65hEYSftXUvYVyYk">
                         here
                        </a>
                        .
                       </p>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </section>
              <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-5ed9c14 elementor-section-content-middle elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="5ed9c14">
               <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
                <div class="elementor-row">
                 <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-50 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-1bd0edc3" data-element_type="column" data-id="1bd0edc3">
                  <div class="elementor-column-wrap elementor-element-populated">
                   <div class="elementor-widget-wrap">
                    <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-50fd416a elementor-invisible elementor-widget elementor-widget-image" data-element_type="widget" data-id="50fd416a" data-settings='{"_animation":"fadeIn"}' data-widget_type="image.default">
                     <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                      <div class="elementor-image">
                       <img alt="" class="attachment-large size-large" decoding="async" height="685" loading="lazy" sizes="auto, (max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://eswochy.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/242512806_10159378155473633_7292721842041891135_n-1024x685.jpg" srcset="https://eswochy.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/242512806_10159378155473633_7292721842041891135_n-1024x685.jpg 1024w, https://eswochy.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/242512806_10159378155473633_7292721842041891135_n-300x201.jpg 300w, https://eswochy.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/242512806_10159378155473633_7292721842041891135_n-768x514.jpg 768w, https://eswochy.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/242512806_10159378155473633_7292721842041891135_n-1536x1028.jpg 1536w, https://eswochy.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/242512806_10159378155473633_7292721842041891135_n.jpg 1936w" width="1024"/>
                      </div>

                 </div>
                 <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-50 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-6d331f33" data-element_type="column" data-id="6d331f33">
                  <div class="elementor-column-wrap elementor-element-populated">
                   <div class="elementor-widget-wrap">
                    <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-4f48c749 elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="4f48c749" data-widget_type="heading.default">
                     <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                      <h2 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
                       Joint Social Work Master's Students: This Programme is life-changing
                      </h2>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-6d7b49c9 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="6d7b49c9" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
                     <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                      <div class="elementor-text-editor elementor-clearfix">
                       <div class="o9v6fnle cxmmr5t8 oygrvhab hcukyx3x c1et5uql ii04i59q">
                        <div dir="auto">
                         MRU students Tainna Souza from Brazil and Yeshna Aodhorah from St. Louis, Mauritius met online while applying to the highly-competitive “European Joint Master in Social Work with Children and Youth” last year. But it was only several weeks ago that the now two best friends met in person and began what they call a “life changing experience” and a “great opportunity” to study in several different universities over the course of 2 years. “Europe is like the center of the world,” said Souza, who hails from Sao Paulo.
                        </div>
                       </div>
                       <div class="o9v6fnle cxmmr5t8 oygrvhab hcukyx3x c1et5uql ii04i59q">
                        <div dir="auto">
                         “I spent 23 years in Brazil and only interacted with Brazilians. I came here to MRU and meet people from all over the world.”
                        </div>
                       </div>
                       <div class="o9v6fnle cxmmr5t8 oygrvhab hcukyx3x c1et5uql ii04i59q">
                        <div dir="auto">
                         Souza, who spent 9 months last year as an au pair in Geneva, Switzerland said it was in Vilnius, at MRU, that she found a more international atmosphere. She said she met more international students at MRU in one week than in 9 months in Geneva. Her friend Yeshna lauds the fantastic Master’s programme saying that you are actually learning at MRU and not studying for an exam. The focus is on learning. The lecturers are fantastic – they come from Riga and from Slovakia, she added.
                         <span style="color: var(--global-palette6); font-family: var(--global-body-font-family);">
                          Both students will spend the next semester in Riga at Stradins University.
                         </span>
                        </div>
                       </div>
                       <div class="o9v6fnle cxmmr5t8 oygrvhab hcukyx3x c1et5uql ii04i59q">
                        <div dir="auto">
                         <span class="pq6dq46d tbxw36s4 knj5qynh kvgmc6g5 ditlmg2l oygrvhab nvdbi5me sf5mxxl7 gl3lb2sf hhz5lgdu">
                          <span style="background-color: transparent; color: var(--global-palette6); font-family: var(--global-body-font-family);">
                           More on the joint Master’s programme
                          </span>
                          <a href="https://www.mruni.eu/.../social-work-with-children-and.../" style="font-family: var(--global-body-font-family);">
                           here
                          </a>
                          <span style="background-color: transparent; color: var(--global-palette6); font-family: var(--global-body-font-family);">
                           .
                          </span>
                         </span>
                        </div>
                        <div dir="auto">
                        </div>
                       </div>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </section>
              <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-58af364 elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="58af364">
               <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
                <div class="elementor-row">
                 <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-66 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-70ac5dc" data-element_type="column" data-id="70ac5dc">
                  <div class="elementor-column-wrap elementor-element-populated">
                   <div class="elementor-widget-wrap">
                    <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-7122d46 elementor-widget elementor-widget-image" data-element_type="widget" data-id="7122d46" data-widget_type="image.default">
                     <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                      <div class="elementor-image">
                       <img alt="" class="attachment-large size-large" decoding="async" height="323" loading="lazy" sizes="auto, (max-width: 435px) 100vw, 435px" src="https://eswochy.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/DSC_0061-435x323-1.jpg" srcset="https://eswochy.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/DSC_0061-435x323-1.jpg 435w, https://eswochy.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/DSC_0061-435x323-1-300x223.jpg 300w" width="435"/>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-33 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-361e923" data-element_type="column" data-id="361e923">
                  <div class="elementor-column-wrap elementor-element-populated">
                   <div class="elementor-widget-wrap">
                    <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-ef28b26 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="ef28b26" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
                     <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                      <div class="elementor-text-editor elementor-clearfix">
                       <h2 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default elementor-inline-editing pen" contenteditable="true" data-elementor-setting-key="title" data-pen-placeholder="Type Here...">
                        Brazilian Student Lauds MRU Joint Master’s Social Work Programme
                       </h2>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-f33bde5 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="f33bde5" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
                     <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                      <div class="elementor-text-editor elementor-clearfix">
                       <p>
                        Mykolas Romeris University (MRU) Master’s Degree student Tainna Souza from Sao Paulo, Brazil worked nights and weekends at a hospital and as a passport checker at São Paulo’s Airport to pay for her Bachelor’s Degree studies in Psychology at Paulista University in Brazil. In addition, she worked on construction sites in various parts of São Paulo to make ends meet. Sometimes, she would arrive for lectures at the University in her construction work clothes because there was no time to change. ‘I had to work really hard to make money to pay for my studies,” said the 24-year-old student, who is now on scholarship and studying in a joint Master’s programme at MRU implemented with 3 other universities: Riga’s Stradins University, Catholic University Ružomberok and Portugal’s ISCTE. “I had to work. I was always working.” Combining studies with work is not easy for any student. However, Tainna’s dream to study in a European Master’s studies programme came true when she was accepted to the competitive “European Joint Master in Social Work with Children and Youth”. Read more
                        <a href="https://www.mruni.eu/en/news/brazilian-student-vilnius-is-the-perfect-place-to-meet-people-from-all-over-the-world/?fbclid=IwAR1D1BNobS0inMv2gHQLLoT_gtXHZcty08Gp4N5f1vBE0Nf_SuVJAVK1G1M">
                         here
                        </a>
                        .
                       </p>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </section>

                   <div class="elementor-widget-wrap">
                    <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-96e1621 elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="96e1621" data-widget_type="heading.default">
                     <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                      <h2 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
                       Master thesis
                      </h2>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-b7569ce elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="b7569ce" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
                     <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                      <div class="elementor-text-editor elementor-clearfix">
                       <p>
                        During the period of the Programme, each student is required to prepare a Master thesis and publicly defend it.
                       </p>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </section>
              <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-f1466cc elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="f1466cc">
               <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
                <div class="elementor-row">
                 <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-100 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-32e5304" data-element_type="column" data-id="32e5304">
                  <div class="elementor-column-wrap elementor-element-populated">
                   <div class="elementor-widget-wrap">
                    <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-588f79c elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="588f79c" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
                     <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                      <div class="elementor-text-editor elementor-clearfix">
                       <h3>
                        Internship “Scientific research practice”
                       </h3>
                       <p>
                        Each ESWOCHY student shall complete Scientific research practice The internship shall be supervised by a professional social worker employed at the organization where the internship takes place, and have a duration of  1 month. Students can choose the internship placement from the prepared list social partners offered by Consortium universities or find placement by themselves, accomplish in their own country, in Consortium partners countries in EU members states, other European or non-European countries. Consortium partners have adequate arrangements for students’ internship. It is organized according to the Internship Training Regulations for Students.
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        Before the internship, introductory lecture and seminars on Scientific Research Practice are organized. Students are introduced with internship tasks, methodical recommendations for an internship, selection of placement, internship documents (Student’s Internship Training Agreement; Supervisor’s Feedback Form), assessment and evaluation criteria. During seminars, students present Research Project which they will implement in the internship. The organization and coordination of student internship is the responsibility of internship supervisors of Consortium partners. Before the internship tripartite Student internship training agreement is signed by a student, legal representative of the organization, and Dean of the Institute / Faculty, and is registered in the Register of internship training agreements of a University. During the internship, students are supervised by supervisors at a university and in an internship placement. Scientific Research Practice and Master Thesis are closely related and include interconnected tasks: students are obligated to carry out pilot research, collect empirical data and/or search for any other relevant data and information for their thesis. Besides students prepare a research report, deliver the results and discuss proposals in the internship institution.  After completion of the Internship, students present Research report and reflect on experience gained in an internship in a workshop.
                       </p>
                       <h3>
                        <strong>
                         Additional requirements
                        </strong>
                       </h3>
                       <p>
                        The students admitted to the Programme that have different educational background than social work are required to take bridge courses during the first study year when they enter the Programme:
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        (a) Social Work Theory and Practice
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        (b) Methodology of Social Work
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        Completion of the Programme
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        The degree shall not be awarded to students unless they have: (1) gathered 120 ECTS within the Programme, (2) completed the four semesters of the Programme, (3) performed the compulsory mobility, (4) completed the internship, and (5) successfully passed the thesis defence.
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        Resits
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        Concerning the examinations, they are done according to local regulations of the concerned university and joint rules approved by the Governing Board. Joint deliberations are undertaken by videoconferences between Consortium Partners to unify decisions, especially in case of problems.
                       </p>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </section>

         <div class="entry-content-wrap">
          <div class="entry-content single-content">
           <h1>
            MRU – Lithuania
           </h1>
           <p>
            <img alt="" class="alignnone wp-image-1845" decoding="async" height="153" sizes="(max-width: 213px) 100vw, 213px" src="https://eswochy.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/MRU_EN_vertikalus_spalvotas_RGB-300x215.png" srcset="https://eswochy.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/MRU_EN_vertikalus_spalvotas_RGB-300x215.png 300w, https://eswochy.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/MRU_EN_vertikalus_spalvotas_RGB-768x550.png 768w, https://eswochy.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/MRU_EN_vertikalus_spalvotas_RGB.png 950w" width="213"/>
           </p>
           <h4>
            1st semester
           </h4>
           <h4>
            Mykolas Romeris University (LT)
           </h4>
           <h4>
            (1st mobility)
           </h4>
           <h4>
            30 ECTS
           </h4>
           <ul>
            <li>
             Comparative European Social Policy for Children Youth
            </li>
            <li>
             Professional Development and Supervision in Social Work
            </li>
            <li>
             Social Work Theories
            </li>
            <li>
             Social Research Methodology
            </li>
            <li>
             Master Thesis
            </li>
           </ul>
           <p>
            The first semester starts with one-day an icebreaking/teambuilding. Informational seminars “Procedure of Studies at MRU” and “Academic ethics and Academic writing at Mykolas Romeris University” will be organized. After the introductory day, is start to implementing ESWOCHY courses of the 1
            <sup>
             st
            </sup>
            semester: Social Work Theories, Professional Development and Supervision in Social Work (including field visits), Social Research Methodology, Comparative European Social Policy for Children and Youth, Master Thesis. Field visits are complemented by the course Professional Development and Supervision in Social Work.
           </p>
          </div>
          <!-- .entry-content -->
         </div>
        </article>

                     <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                      <div class="elementor-text-editor elementor-clearfix">
                       <p align="center" style="margin-bottom: 6pt; line-height: normal; text-align: center;">
                        <b>
                         <span lang="EN-US" style="font-size: 15.0pt; font-family: 'Bahnschrift Light',sans-serif; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; color: red; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: LT;">
                          The ESWOCHY is no longer accepting new applications
                         </span>
                        </b>
                        <b>
                         <span lang="EN-US" style="font-size: 20.0pt; font-family: 'Bahnschrift Light',sans-serif; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: LT;">
                          Deadlines
                         </span>
                        </b>

                       <p style="margin-bottom: 16.5pt; line-height: 21.75pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">
                        <b>
                         <span lang="EN-US" style="font-size: 13.0pt; font-family: 'Bahnschrift Light',sans-serif; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: LT;">
                          Application procedures:
                         </span>
                        </b>
                       </p>
                       <table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse: collapse; border: none; mso-border-alt: solid windowtext .5pt; mso-yfti-tbllook: 1184; mso-padding-alt: 0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt;">
                        <tbody>
                         <tr>
                          <td style="width: 178.7pt; border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; mso-border-alt: solid windowtext .5pt; padding: 0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt;" width="238">
                           <p style="margin-bottom: 22.5pt; line-height: normal;">
                            <b>
                             <span lang="EN-US" style="font-size: 12.0pt; font-family: 'Bahnschrift Light',sans-serif; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: LT;">
                              Countries
                             </span>
                            </b>
                            <a href="https://erasmus-plus.ec.europa.eu/programme-guide/part-a/eligible-countries">
                             <b>
                              <span lang="EN-US" style="font-size: 12.0pt; font-family: 'Bahnschrift Light',sans-serif; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: LT;">

                              </span>

                            </a>
                            <b>
                            </b>

                          </td>
                          <td style="width: 179.6pt; border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; border-left: none; mso-border-left-alt: solid windowtext .5pt; mso-border-alt: solid windowtext .5pt; padding: 0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt;" width="239">
                           <p style="margin-bottom: 22.5pt; line-height: normal;">
                            <b>
                             <span lang="EN-US" style="font-size: 12.0pt; font-family: 'Bahnschrift Light',sans-serif; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: LT;">
                              Stage
                             </span>
                            </b>
                           </p>
                          </td>
                          <td style="width: 123.1pt; border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; border-left: none; mso-border-left-alt: solid windowtext .5pt; mso-border-alt: solid windowtext .5pt; padding: 0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt;" valign="top" width="164">
                           <p style="margin-bottom: 16.5pt; line-height: 21.75pt;">
                            <b>
                             <span lang="EN-US" style="font-size: 12.0pt; font-family: 'Bahnschrift Light',sans-serif; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: LT;">

                             </span>
                            </b>
                           </p>
                          </td>

              <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-10371256 elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="10371256">
               <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
                <div class="elementor-row">
                 <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-100 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-90a64ff" data-element_type="column" data-id="90a64ff">
                  <div class="elementor-column-wrap elementor-element-populated">
                   <div class="elementor-widget-wrap">
                    <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-75883298 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="75883298" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
                     <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                      <div class="elementor-text-editor elementor-clearfix">
                       <p style="text-align: center;">
                        <b>
                         <span lang="EN-US" style="font-size: 24.0pt; font-family: 'Bahnschrift Light',sans-serif; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-font-kerning: 18.0pt; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: LT;">
                          STUDENT SELECTION, ADMISSION AND ENROLLMENT
                         </span>
                        </b>
                        <b style="background-color: transparent; color: var(--global-palette6); font-family: var(--global-body-font-family);">
                         <span lang="EN-US" style="font-size: 24.0pt; font-family: 'Bahnschrift Light',sans-serif; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-font-kerning: 18.0pt; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: LT;">
                          CONDITIONS
                         </span>
                        </b>
                       </p>
                       <p align="center" class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 6.0pt; text-align: center; mso-line-height-alt: 16.8pt; mso-outline-level: 2;">
                        <b>
                         <span lang="EN-US" style="font-size: 22.5pt; font-family: 'Bahnschrift Light',sans-serif; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: LT;">
                          1. STUDENT ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA
                         </span>
                        </b>
                       </p>
                       <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 6pt; line-height: 15.6pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">
                        <b>
                         <span lang="EN-US" style="font-size: 15.0pt; font-family: 'Bahnschrift Light',sans-serif; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: LT;">
                          Minimum requirements
                         </span>
                        </b>
                       </p>
                       <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">
                        <span lang="EN-US" style="font-size: 13pt; font-family: 'Bahnschrift Light', sans-serif;">
                         In order to participate in the competition for the enrolment to the Programme, the candidate must comply with the minimum requirements concerning:
                        </span>
                       </p>
                       <ul type="disc">
                        <li class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: normal; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">
                         <span lang="EN-US" style="font-size: 13.0pt; font-family: 'Bahnschrift Light',sans-serif; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: LT;">
                          Administrative prerequisites;
                         </span>
                        </li>
                        <li class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: normal; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">
                         <span lang="EN-US" style="font-size: 13.0pt; font-family: 'Bahnschrift Light',sans-serif; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: LT;">
                          Academic prerequisites;
                         </span>
                        </li>
                        <li class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: normal; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">
                         <span lang="EN-US" style="font-size: 13.0pt; font-family: 'Bahnschrift Light',sans-serif; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: LT;">
                          Language prerequisites.
                         </span>
                        </li>
                       </ul>
                       <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin: 18pt 0cm 6pt; line-height: 15.6pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">
                        <b>
                         <span lang="EN-US" style="font-size: 15.0pt; font-family: 'Bahnschrift Light',sans-serif; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: LT;">
                          Administrative prerequisites
                         </span>
                        </b>
                       </p>
                       <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">
                        <span lang="EN-US" style="font-size: 13pt; font-family: 'Bahnschrift Light', sans-serif;">
                         1. Compliance with the application deadlines;
                        </span>
                       </p>
                       <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;">
                        <span lang="EN-US" style="font-size: 13pt; font-family: 'Bahnschrift Light', sans-serif;">
                         2. Submission of a complete set of required application documents in English language versions (certified English translation, if required). If the admission committee is asking for additional documents, it has to be submitted within 2 weeks. If the required documents are not received within 2 weeks, the application is no longer considered.
                        </span>
                       </p>
                       <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;">
                        <span lang="EN-US" style="font-size: 13pt; font-family: 'Bahnschrift Light', sans-serif;">
                         3. Non-submitted applications, incomplete applications and applications received after the application deadline will not be taken into consideration.
                        </span>
                       </p>
                       <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin: 18pt 0cm 6pt; line-height: 15.6pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">
                        <b>
                         <span lang="EN-US" style="font-size: 15.0pt; font-family: 'Bahnschrift Light',sans-serif; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: LT;">
                          Academic prerequisites
                         </span>
                        </b>
                       </p>
                       <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">
                        <span lang="EN-US" style="font-size: 13pt; font-family: 'Bahnschrift Light', sans-serif;">
                         Applicants eligible for the Programme must be holders of Bachelor’s degree/1st Cycle or the equivalent University level higher education degree in the field of
                         <b>
                          Social Work, Social Pedagogy, Psychology, Sociology, Social Policy
                         </b>
                         , and
                         <b>
                          Social Welfare.
                         </b>
                         The considered average score is 15 in the scale of 20 (see information below). Priority will be given to candidates who have:
                        </span>
                       </p>
                       <ul type="disc">
                        <li class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: normal; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">
                         <span lang="EN-US" style="font-size: 13.0pt; font-family: 'Bahnschrift Light',sans-serif; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: LT;">
                          Bachelor in Social Work;
                         </span>
                        </li>
                        <li class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: normal; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">
                         <span lang="EN-US" style="font-size: 13.0pt; font-family: 'Bahnschrift Light',sans-serif; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: LT;">
                          at least 2 years of professional or voluntary experience in
                          <b>
                           the field of social work
                          </b>
                          , which can be documented;
                         </span>
                        </li>
                        <li class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: normal; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">
                         <span lang="EN-US" style="font-size: 13.0pt; font-family: 'Bahnschrift Light',sans-serif; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: LT;">
                          experience in research projects, conducting research and publishing its results in scientific publications.
                         </span>
                        </li>
                       </ul>
                       <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">
                        <span lang="EN-US" style="font-size: 13pt; font-family: 'Bahnschrift Light', sans-serif;">
                         Graduates from other social science field (Economics, law, communication, political science, management and administration) can be considered if:
                        </span>
                       </p>
                       <ul>
                        <li class="MsoListParagraphCxSpFirst" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: -18pt; line-height: normal; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">
                         <span lang="EN-US" style="font-size: 13pt; font-family: Symbol;">
                          <span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: 'Times New Roman';">
                          </span>
                         </span>
                         <span lang="EN-US" style="font-size: 13pt; font-family: 'Bahnschrift Light', sans-serif;">
                          their completed education is assessed by the Admission Committee as equivalent/sufficient and their experience in the field of social work is definitely superior to other candidates.
                         </span>
                        </li>
                        <li class="MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: -18pt; line-height: normal; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">
                         <span style="font-size: 13.0pt; font-family: Symbol; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol;">
                          <span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: 'Times New Roman';">
                          </span>
                         </span>
                         <span style="font-size: 13.0pt; font-family: 'Bahnschrift Light',sans-serif;">
                          they apply for self-funded places
                         </span>
                        </li>
                        <li class="MsoListParagraphCxSpLast" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: -18pt; line-height: normal; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">
                         <span lang="EN-US" style="font-size: 13.0pt; font-family: Symbol; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: LT;">
                          <span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: 'Times New Roman';">
                           <span style="font-family: Symbol;">
                           </span>
                          </span>
                          <span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: 'Times New Roman';">
                          </span>
                         </span>
                         <!--[endif]-->
                         <span style="font-size: 13.0pt; font-family: 'Bahnschrift Light',sans-serif;">
                          there are places left from EMJM after admission is completed
                         </span>
                        </li>
                       </ul>
                       <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">
                        <span lang="EN-US" style="font-size: 12.0pt; font-family: 'Bahnschrift Light',sans-serif; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: LT;">
                        </span>
                       </p>
                       <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin: 18pt 0cm 6pt; line-height: 15.6pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">
                        <b>
                         <span lang="EN-US" style="font-size: 15.0pt; font-family: 'Bahnschrift Light',sans-serif; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: LT;">
                          Language prerequisites
                         </span>
                        </b>
